content.description: start with a right hand sidepull right of the arete and a left hand sloper on the arete. Move up and left through sidepulls and high crimps to a sloper. Make a devilish mantle to hit a jug rail near the top. The rest is easy peasy.
content.location: the first arete you see when making your way to icehouse, right next to the tufa-like pinch

content.description: Start with low holds. Make move out left to sloper. Work yout way up small prow.
Sit start with opposing sidepulls and go straight up and slightly right to mantle on slopers
content.location: The uphill arete of the small boulder to the left of Icehouse

content.description:
Start low on decent crimps on the right side of the scooped face. The right hand crimp is on the right side of the right arete. Climb past the unique tufa-like pinch to a jug, and finish straight up the technical face. (Kelly)

In all, great movement!
content.protection: 2-3 pads. The boulder is tall, but the landing is generally flat.
content.location: Facing the road on the Icehouse boulder.

content.description:
Left hand small crimp- rt hand high side pull.

Work ur feet up. To shit slopers in a shallow dihedral. Fun!!
content.location: To the right of a tree on icehouse boulder

content.description: Begin on the arete with a poor left hand slimper and a right hand undercling. Establish your feet (some good edges on the left face) and keep working up. Eventually you can stand up to the jug rail on the right side of the face and enjoy a fairly casual top out, in my humble opinion.
content.location:
This arete is on the lookers left side of the south face. If you're familiar with the other boulder problems, it's the arete between the technical slab climb "Tall boy" on your right and the face climb/press out "Ice Grip".

Doesn't see as much love as the other lines here so it will probably look chalk-less and dirty.

content.description: Establish using one of many difficult methods and crimp up the face on sidepulls and poor feet to a slightly insecure top out. Pretty fun!
content.location: Start on the backside of the main boulder (further past Bear Hug) between the large Ponderosa and adjacent small boulder.

content.description: Start on a good left hand and a right hand sloper, climb up to establish on crimps then dyno to the jug above.
content.location: Up the hillside from the main Icehouse cluster. Follow the faint trail uphill and slightly left (up canyon) and look for the diamond shaped boulder.

content.description: Left on arete. Right hand on opposing upper rail right beneath bulge. Crank to flat edges to a thrutchy finish
content.location: Opposite end of from The ice House problem.
